basics.name: Asim Zulfiqar
basics.label: IoT developer and content creator
basics.summary: IoT | Photonics | Cloud Computing | STEM Trainer | Tech blogger and Content Creator

work.name: Leibniz-Rechenzentrum
work.position: Scientific Programmer for IoT Research Projects
work.summary: The work involved real-time IoT data collection using LoRaWAN, TTN, and MQTT, alongside the definition and implementation of REST APIs to facilitate the exchange of IoT sensor data. A web-based user interface was designed and implemented to connect InfluxDB with Grafana, enhancing data visualization. Additionally, automatic monitoring and alerting for data delivery were extended using Prometheus. The project also included virtual server management in the LRZ Compute Cloud, which was carried out using Ansible.

work.name: High Voltages
work.summary: I created and managed high-quality content for How-to blogs and video tutorials on IoT protocols, embedded systems, and Python programming, covering over 50 topics. My work garnered over 1 million views across a blog and YouTube channel. I utilized technical writing skills to simplify complex concepts for a non-technical audience, leveraged SEO techniques to enhance content visibility, and applied content marketing strategies to boost engagement. Additionally, I conducted extensive research to ensure accuracy and stay updated on industry trends.

work.name: Freelance (Fiverr & upwork)
work.summary: I have successfully completed over 300 projects with positive feedback on Fiverr and Upwork, providing a wide range of services including embedded systems (Arduino, Raspberry Pi, ESP8266, ESP32, Nrf52), IoT development and cloud integration (MQTT, HTTP, AWS, IoT Azure, TTN), online STEM training, mobile app development, computer programming (Python, Java, C, C++), and technical content writing. My work spans various industries, such as healthcare, gaming, automation, and agriculture, where I have leveraged my expertise in embedded systems and IoT to deliver solutions that consistently exceed client expectations.

work.name: First Code Acadmey (Remote)
work.summary: I taught young children programming skills, including block programming, Scratch, Python, and application development using MIT App Inventor and Android Studio. I also developed and implemented lesson plans, assessed student progress, and collaborated with other instructors to design and deliver STEM programs.

work.name: CNIT - Consorzio Nazionale Interuniversitario per le Telecomunicazioni
work.summary: I developed software for a Container Tracking Device (CTD) using ESP32, Quectel BG96, and various sensors, enabling the Sensor Unit to send UDP packets with JSON payloads to a cloud platform (ICON). Additionally, I created software for a GW NB-IoT/BLE Mesh to act as a provisioner for a BLE mesh network, sending sensor data to the ICON platform. I collaborated on a CTD data model with the client (CNIT), developed software on the HUZZAH32 ESP32 FEATHER platform with a Quectel BG95 shield, and documented everything in a GitLab repository.

work.name: TechTree
work.summary: As a STEM Trainer, I instructed school students in block programming, Scratch programming, circuit design basics, and introduced them to trending technologies like AI, computer vision, game development, and augmented reality, using a practical approach to teach STEM concepts. As an IoT Developer, I designed and developed IoT-based products, including a Smart Air Conditioner controlling device that allows users to control their AC devices remotely via the Internet.

work.name: Greenertronics
work.summary: I have experience working with development boards and microcontrollers like Arduino and Raspberry Pi, and I was responsible for optimizing the power consumption of DC fans.

work.name: Pakistan International Airlines
work.summary: I have learned about avionics and the communication technologies used by airlines and aircraft.

publications.name: Hands-on ESP32 with Arduino IDE: Unleash the power of IoT with ESP32 and build exciting projects with this practical guide
publications.summary: I've authored "Hands-on ESP32 with Arduino IDE," a practical guide for electronics enthusiasts and professionals interested in IoT development. This book explains the ESP32 microcontroller and Arduino IDE 2.0, offering clear instructions on sensor interfacing, network protocols, and building real-world IoT projects. Whether you're a beginner or have some electronics experience, this book empowers you to create smart, connected devices and delve into the exciting possibilities of IoT.

publications.name: Quantum Computer Metrics and HPC Center Environmental Sensor Data Analysis Towards Fidelity Prediction
publications.summary: I contributed in advancing environmental data monitoring and alerting for Quantum Computers, contributing to the implementation of sensors. My work ensures real-time tracking of crucial metrics and swift response to anomalies in HPCQC setups.

projects.name: IoT wearable social band – COSOT BAND
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
